entry.title: How to Bypass Google FRP Lock from Realme 12+ 5G Devices
entry.content:
How to Bypass Google FRP Lock on Realme 12+ 5G Devices

Technological advancements in the IT and telecommunication industry simplify your tasks and provide security against cyber malpractices. The advantages are numerous and appealing, but there are downsides too. One such inconvenience is caused by Google FRP lock in Realme 12+ 5G smartphones. The facility keeps your device information safe against unauthorized access. However, users often report issues like lockouts not being removed due to several causes. Such scenarios raise the demand for Realme 12+ 5G Nord FRP bypass solutions for seamless device access.

Part 1. What Is Google FRP and How Does It Work?

Google Factory Reset Protection (FRP) is an in-built security function in Android 5.1 and later versions. The feature protects these devices against intentional data loss on unauthorized access. The utility does not allow a factory reset of your device in case it is lost or stolen. Your data is hence, safe from unwanted mishandling. The feature also protects the Realme 12+ 5G device’s data encryptions and screen locks. The functionality gets enabled when you register a Google account on your Android device. As is obvious, the feature gets disabled when the Google account is removed before beginning the Factory Data Reset process.

If your device is under untrusted access and the FRP lock is enabled, the latter will prevent the factory reset of your phone. It is because; the active FRP lock requires entering the Google account credentials registered with the Realme 12+ 5G device. Therefore, unwanted users will not be possible to factory reset the Realme 12+ 5G phone. However, there may be instances when you need to factory reset your FRP-enabled device to its default settings. Ensure that the registered Google account credentials are available to you under such circumstances.

Part 2. How to Remove Google FRP Lock on Any Realme 12+ 5G Phone?

To remove the Google FRP lock on your Realme 12+ 5G device, you can follow any of the methods discussed below:

1. Bypass Google FRP Lock on Your Realme 12+ 5G Phone

  • Switch on the Wi-Fi network of the Realme 12+ 5G phone and head to the ‘Hello’ screen.
  • Take the following path:

Emergency Call> Emergency Rescue> Add Contact

  • When the permission prompt pops up, click on ‘Deny’ and tap “Go to Settings”.
  • Hit the ‘Permission’ tab and tap the ‘Search’ button.
  • Enter ‘Settings’ in the search field, choose the ‘Settings App Info’ option, and tap the ‘Open’ button.
  • Take the path given below to enable the system shortcuts:

System> Accessibility> Accessibility Menu> Toggle the Button to Turn it On> Allow> Got it

  • Head to the “Settings” app and tap “Apps and Notifications”. Next, click on “See All Apps”.
  • Find and disable the ‘Android Setup’ and ‘Google Play Service’ within the application list.

  • Navigate back to the ‘Hello’ screen to completely disable the setup by taking the following path:

Start> Agree> Agree> Skip> Don’t Copy> Ok> Agree

  • Skip the ‘Set Screen Lock’ task for completing the setup.

2. Using FRP Bypass APK

This is a quick and smart way to address the FRP lock removal issue within several minutes. Here’s what you need to do:

  • Download the FRP Bypass APK to a PC or some other smartphone from the latter’s official website, followed by copying it into a pen drive.
  • Use an OTG to connect the pen drive to the FRP-locked device.
  • Head to the destination folder of the downloaded APK in the “File Manager” application.
  • Install the APK in the FRP-locked phone by allowing the app permissions.
  • Navigate to ‘Settings’ and enable the ‘Install from Unknown Source’ option.
  • Reinstall and open the APK.
  • The ‘Settings’ menu will pop up. Head to the “Backup and Reset” option.
  • Click on ‘Factory Data Reset’, followed by “Erase Everything”.
  • Tap ‘Confirm’ to erase all the Realme 12+ 5G device data.
  • Register with a new Google account to use the phone.

Click here
### 3\. Deactivate FRP in Your Realme 12+ 5G Phone

Removing the Google FRP lock using a computer is impossible in some instances. Deleting your registered Gmail account from the Realme 12+ 5G device can help you in these circumstances. The downside of this method is that your device’s data will lose protection from Google. Here’s how you can delete your Gmail account from the FRP-locked phone:

  • Launch the “Settings” app on your Realme 12+ 5G device.

  • In the app’s opening interface, click on the ‘Accounts’ tab to open the section.

  • A list of all the accounts linked to your Realme 12+ 5G device will be displayed. Tap on the desired Gmail account to unlink it from your phone.

  • The device data linked with the selected account will appear on the screen. Click on ‘Remove Account’ to proceed further.

  • A confirmation prompt will pop up to ensure a willful deletion of the account from the Realme 12+ 5G device. Tap on ‘Remove Account’ to confirm the action. This will cause all data linked with the account to get deleted from the phone.

FAQs about Google Lock Bypass

1. Does Factory Reset Remove Google Account?

There may be instances when you require wiping out smartphone data to keep it safe against unauthorized access. Maybe you wish to pass on your device to another user or migrate to a different device. It is important to make sure that all accounts linked to the phone are deleted from the Realme 12+ 5G device. It should be understood here that a factory reset will not remove Google or other accounts from the Realme 12+ 5G device. The process restores the default factory settings of the phone that you got at the first purchase.

2. How to Enable Factory Reset Protection?

Enabling the Factory Reset protection feature is a smart way to protect the important data on your phone. However, issues of unethical access in cases of theft or loss are quite prominent. You can enable the FRP functionality by taking the following steps:

  • When using a new device, sign in to the phone with your Google account. You can use an existing account or create a new one.
  • Set a pattern or password screen lock on your device. It is not advisable to use swipe unlock or leave the phone unlocked at all. If you forget the pattern or password, Google credentials can be used to unlock the Realme 12+ 5G device.

These steps will cause the automatic configuration of the Factory Reset Protection feature. The invader will be prompted to enter the registered Google account credentials on every attempt to access the phone.

Conclusion

Developments in electronic technology have brought a series of benefits, covering easy access, security, and everything in between. One such feature is the Google Factory Reset Protection to protect your device data against untrusted access. The feature is undoubtedly credible, but there may be situations that require bypassing the FRP lock. For affordable solutions to address the concern on Realme 12+ 5G phones, pick the one that corresponds to your specific situation.

Part 1: What is FRP lock on Realme?

Almost all smartphones come with multiple built-in security and protection features to ensure no 3rd party operator or tool can access the data stored in the system memory or the Realme 12+ 5G device. However, if someone initiates the factory reset in your Realme smartphone, the person will easily access everything in the Realme 12+ 5G device and the system.

This is where the FRP or factory reset protection program comes in. It is a built-in safety feature in smartphones that lock the Realme 12+ 5G device as soon as a factory reset is initiated or the user does not enter valid credentials for the Google account. Once the lock is activated, deactivation is very difficult, and it requires the credentials to access the system once again.

As a result, the user cannot restore the Realme 12+ 5G device to its default mode through a factory reset and wipe every data from both system and device memory. The FRP program has proven beneficial for optimal data protection from piracy and unauthorized access. This way, even if you lose your phone or it gets stolen, no one will be able to initiate the reset program to wipe everything from the Realme 12+ 5G device.

The FRP program is not available on all smartphones from Realme. Suppose you want to check whether it is compatible with your smartphone model, open settings from your phone, and go to the Realme 12+ 5G device information section. There, you will be able to see the factory reset option.

Though the protection is meant for you, sometimes you may forget the password and want your Realme 12+ 5G FRP removed. Also, if you bought a used phone and the previous user has set up FRP with her password, you need to bypass it.

Part 1: In what cases does the Realme 12+ 5G FRP bypass works?

How and why should I bypass Realme 12+ 5G FRP? Let us look at the valid reasons.

1. Buy a locked second-hand Realme

When you buy a second-hand phone, ideally, the previous user must format and hard reset the Realme phone to remove all locks and password requirements. However, if it doesn’t happen, you cannot use some options on your phone and configure security because of FRP. Here, your savior is the option of the Realme 12+ 5G FRP bypass.

2. Forget Google account ID and password

Even if you have locked your Realme phone yourself, you are stuck when you forget your Google username and password. So, you can only recover your phone using the Realme 12+ 5G FRP bypass.

Some employees also receive official phones from their company which they have to return when they leave the company. Now, it becomes a horror story for the new employee if he gets the same phone locked with the previous user’s ID.

How to Bypass Google FRP Lock on Realme C53 Devices

Part 1. What Is Google FRP and How Does It Work?

Google Factory Reset Protection (FRP) is an in-built security function in Android 5.1 and later versions. The feature protects these devices against intentional data loss on unauthorized access. The utility does not allow a factory reset of your device in case it is lost or stolen. Your data is hence, safe from unwanted mishandling. The feature also protects the Realme C53 device’s data encryptions and screen locks. The functionality gets enabled when you register a Google account on your Android device. As is obvious, the feature gets disabled when the Google account is removed before beginning the Factory Data Reset process.

If your device is under untrusted access and the FRP lock is enabled, the latter will prevent the factory reset of your phone. It is because; the active FRP lock requires entering the Google account credentials registered with the Realme C53 device. Therefore, unwanted users will not be possible to factory reset the Realme C53 phone. However, there may be instances when you need to factory reset your FRP-enabled device to its default settings. Ensure that the registered Google account credentials are available to you under such circumstances.

  • Hit the ‘Permission’ tab and tap the ‘Search’ button.
  • Enter ‘Settings’ in the search field, choose the ‘Settings App Info’ option, and tap the ‘Open’ button.
  • Take the path given below to enable the system shortcuts:

System> Accessibility> Accessibility Menu> Toggle the Button to Turn it On> Allow> Got it

  • Head to the “Settings” app and tap “Apps and Notifications”. Next, click on “See All Apps”.
  • Find and disable the ‘Android Setup’ and ‘Google Play Service’ within the application list.

  • Navigate back to the ‘Hello’ screen to completely disable the setup by taking the following path:

Start> Agree> Agree> Skip> Don’t Copy> Ok> Agree

  • Skip the ‘Set Screen Lock’ task for completing the setup.

  • Install the APK in the FRP-locked phone by allowing the app permissions.
  • Navigate to ‘Settings’ and enable the ‘Install from Unknown Source’ option.
  • Reinstall and open the APK.
  • The ‘Settings’ menu will pop up. Head to the “Backup and Reset” option.
  • Click on ‘Factory Data Reset’, followed by “Erase Everything”.
  • Tap ‘Confirm’ to erase all the Realme C53 device data.

3. Deactivate FRP in Your Realme C53 Phone

Removing the Google FRP lock using a computer is impossible in some instances. Deleting your registered Gmail account from the Realme C53 device can help you in these circumstances. The downside of this method is that your device’s data will lose protection from Google. Here’s how you can delete your Gmail account from the FRP-locked phone:

  • Launch the “Settings” app on your Realme C53 device.

  • The device data linked with the selected account will appear on the screen. Click on ‘Remove Account’ to proceed further.

  • A confirmation prompt will pop up to ensure a willful deletion of the account from the Realme C53 device. Tap on ‘Remove Account’ to confirm the action. This will cause all data linked with the account to get deleted from the phone.

entry.title: How to Bypass Google FRP Lock from Realme C67 4G Devices
entry.content:
How to Bypass Google FRP Lock on Realme C67 4G Devices

Technological advancements in the IT and telecommunication industry simplify your tasks and provide security against cyber malpractices. The advantages are numerous and appealing, but there are downsides too. One such inconvenience is caused by Google FRP lock in Realme C67 4G smartphones. The facility keeps your device information safe against unauthorized access. However, users often report issues like lockouts not being removed due to several causes. Such scenarios raise the demand for Realme C67 4G Nord FRP bypass solutions for seamless device access.

Part 1. What Is Google FRP and How Does It Work?

Google Factory Reset Protection (FRP) is an in-built security function in Android 5.1 and later versions. The feature protects these devices against intentional data loss on unauthorized access. The utility does not allow a factory reset of your device in case it is lost or stolen. Your data is hence, safe from unwanted mishandling. The feature also protects the Realme C67 4G device’s data encryptions and screen locks. The functionality gets enabled when you register a Google account on your Android device. As is obvious, the feature gets disabled when the Google account is removed before beginning the Factory Data Reset process.

If your device is under untrusted access and the FRP lock is enabled, the latter will prevent the factory reset of your phone. It is because; the active FRP lock requires entering the Google account credentials registered with the Realme C67 4G device. Therefore, unwanted users will not be possible to factory reset the Realme C67 4G phone. However, there may be instances when you need to factory reset your FRP-enabled device to its default settings. Ensure that the registered Google account credentials are available to you under such circumstances.

Part 2. How to Remove Google FRP Lock on Any Realme C67 4G Phone?

To remove the Google FRP lock on your Realme C67 4G device, you can follow any of the methods discussed below:

1. Bypass Google FRP Lock on Your Realme C67 4G Phone

  • Switch on the Wi-Fi network of the Realme C67 4G phone and head to the ‘Hello’ screen.
  • Take the following path:

Emergency Call> Emergency Rescue> Add Contact

  • When the permission prompt pops up, click on ‘Deny’ and tap “Go to Settings”.
  • Hit the ‘Permission’ tab and tap the ‘Search’ button.
  • Enter ‘Settings’ in the search field, choose the ‘Settings App Info’ option, and tap the ‘Open’ button.
  • Take the path given below to enable the system shortcuts:

System> Accessibility> Accessibility Menu> Toggle the Button to Turn it On> Allow> Got it

  • Head to the “Settings” app and tap “Apps and Notifications”. Next, click on “See All Apps”.
  • Find and disable the ‘Android Setup’ and ‘Google Play Service’ within the application list.

  • Navigate back to the ‘Hello’ screen to completely disable the setup by taking the following path:

Start> Agree> Agree> Skip> Don’t Copy> Ok> Agree

  • Skip the ‘Set Screen Lock’ task for completing the setup.

2. Using FRP Bypass APK

This is a quick and smart way to address the FRP lock removal issue within several minutes. Here’s what you need to do:

  • Download the FRP Bypass APK to a PC or some other smartphone from the latter’s official website, followed by copying it into a pen drive.
  • Use an OTG to connect the pen drive to the FRP-locked device.
  • Head to the destination folder of the downloaded APK in the “File Manager” application.
  • Install the APK in the FRP-locked phone by allowing the app permissions.
  • Navigate to ‘Settings’ and enable the ‘Install from Unknown Source’ option.
  • Reinstall and open the APK.
  • The ‘Settings’ menu will pop up. Head to the “Backup and Reset” option.
  • Click on ‘Factory Data Reset’, followed by “Erase Everything”.
  • Tap ‘Confirm’ to erase all the Realme C67 4G device data.
  • Register with a new Google account to use the phone.

3. Deactivate FRP in Your Realme C67 4G Phone

Removing the Google FRP lock using a computer is impossible in some instances. Deleting your registered Gmail account from the Realme C67 4G device can help you in these circumstances. The downside of this method is that your device’s data will lose protection from Google. Here’s how you can delete your Gmail account from the FRP-locked phone:

  • Launch the “Settings” app on your Realme C67 4G device.

  • In the app’s opening interface, click on the ‘Accounts’ tab to open the section.

  • A list of all the accounts linked to your Realme C67 4G device will be displayed. Tap on the desired Gmail account to unlink it from your phone.

  • The device data linked with the selected account will appear on the screen. Click on ‘Remove Account’ to proceed further.

  • A confirmation prompt will pop up to ensure a willful deletion of the account from the Realme C67 4G device. Tap on ‘Remove Account’ to confirm the action. This will cause all data linked with the account to get deleted from the phone.

FAQs about Google Lock Bypass

### 1\. Does Factory Reset Remove Google Account?

There may be instances when you require wiping out smartphone data to keep it safe against unauthorized access. Maybe you wish to pass on your device to another user or migrate to a different device. It is important to make sure that all accounts linked to the phone are deleted from the Realme C67 4G device. It should be understood here that a factory reset will not remove Google or other accounts from the Realme C67 4G device. The process restores the default factory settings of the phone that you got at the first purchase.

2. How to Enable Factory Reset Protection?

Enabling the Factory Reset protection feature is a smart way to protect the important data on your phone. However, issues of unethical access in cases of theft or loss are quite prominent. You can enable the FRP functionality by taking the following steps:

  • When using a new device, sign in to the phone with your Google account. You can use an existing account or create a new one.
  • Set a pattern or password screen lock on your device. It is not advisable to use swipe unlock or leave the phone unlocked at all. If you forget the pattern or password, Google credentials can be used to unlock the Realme C67 4G device.

These steps will cause the automatic configuration of the Factory Reset Protection feature. The invader will be prompted to enter the registered Google account credentials on every attempt to access the phone.

Conclusion

Developments in electronic technology have brought a series of benefits, covering easy access, security, and everything in between. One such feature is the Google Factory Reset Protection to protect your device data against untrusted access. The feature is undoubtedly credible, but there may be situations that require bypassing the FRP lock. For affordable solutions to address the concern on Realme C67 4G phones, pick the one that corresponds to your specific situation.

## A Step-by-Step Guide on Using ADB and Fastboot to Remove FRP Lock on your Realme C67 4G

Factory Reset Protection is one of the security measures available on Android 5.1 and later devices to prevent intruders’ unauthorized factory resetting of the Realme C67 4G device. Among the several ways to fix this issue and remove the lock, one is ADB and Fastboot commands. So, if you are aware of using Android Debug Bridge, the below content will help you understand how it can be used to remove the FRP lock.

You can watch the video below to bypass FRP lock without hassle!

Part 1: Quick Overview of ADB and Fastboot Commands

1. What are ADB and Fastboot?

Standing for Android Debug Bridge, ADB and Fastboots are the methods through which communication with an Android device can be done through a computer. Under this method, the commands and the actions that are sent from the system are performed on your Android device.

Several issues can be resolved, and multiple functions can be performed using the ADB format tool and Fastboots, and this also includes removing the FRP lock on your Android device. To use this method, USB debugging should be enabled on the Realme C67 4G device.

For specific brands of Android phones, specific utility tools are available like the Vivo ADB format tool and the Samsung ADB format tool, which are used explicitly for Vivo and Samsung phones, respectively.

2. How Do ADB and Fastboot Bypass FRP?

Using the versatile ADB command-line tool and Fastboots, the Google FRP lock can be removed using several commands depending on the OS version. This is a client-server program that includes a client who sends the commands, a daemon used to run the commands on the Realme C67 4G device, and a server that facilitates communication between the client and the daemon.

ADB comes included in the Android SDK Platform-Tools package, and this can be downloaded using the SDK manager.

3. What Are the Android Versions that ADB and Fastboot Command Support?

The Android versions on which ADB and Fastboot commands can be used are as follows:

  • _Android 5 – Lollipop_
  • _Android 6- Marshmellow_
  • _Android 7 – Nougat_
  • _Android 8- Oreo_
  • _Android 9- Pie_
  • _Android 10 – Q (expected to work though not tested as yet)_

Part 2: How to Set Up ADB and Fastboot Commands to Remove FRP Lock on Android?

To remove FRP lock using ADB, you first need to install and set up ADB and then remove them using the command. The steps for the same are enlisted below.

Steps to remove FRP using ADB

  • Step 1. Firstly, download the ADB installed setup file and then extract the files from the toolkit on your system in a folder.

  • Step 2. Next, you need to run adb.setup.exe and then type Y for installing the drivers for ADB and Fastboot.

  • Step 3. Again, enter Y for installing the drivers and when done successfully, the command window will close.

  • Step 4. Next, power on your Android device and connect it to your PC using a USB cable. Here also ensure that USB debugging mode is enabled on your Android device.

  • Step 5. Next, hold down the Shift key and then right-click at any place blank in the ADB folder, and then choose the Open command window here option.

  • Step 6. Now to remove the FRP you need to enter the following commands at the command prompt one by one where enter needs to be clicked after every line.

  • _Adb shell am start -n com.google.android.gsf.login/_

  • _adb shell am start -n com.google.android.gsf.login.LoginActivity_

  • _adb shell content insert –uri content://settings/secure –bind name:s:user_setup_complete –bind value:s:1_

  • Step 7. The above commands are for Samsung devices. If you want to remove the FRP on other brands, enter the following commands:

  • _Adb shell content insert –uri content://settings/secure –bind_

  • _name:s:user_setup_complete –bind value:s:1_

After the execution of the commands, the FRP lock will be removed from your Android device.

Steps to remove FRP using Fastboot

  • Step 1. Put the Android device into the bootloader or fastboot mode. (depending on the model and brand of your Android device, the process of entering into the fastboot will differ).

  • Step 2. Connect your phone to your PC using a USB cable.

  • Step 3. Next, depending on the system, enter the following command in the CMD window:

  • _Lenovo FRP command_

  • _fastboot erase config_

  • _fastboot reboot_

  • _XIAOMI FRP command_

entry.title: How to Bypass Google FRP Lock from Realme GT 5 Devices
entry.content:
How to Bypass Google FRP Lock on Realme GT 5 Devices

Technological advancements in the IT and telecommunication industry simplify your tasks and provide security against cyber malpractices. The advantages are numerous and appealing, but there are downsides too. One such inconvenience is caused by Google FRP lock in Realme GT 5 smartphones. The facility keeps your device information safe against unauthorized access. However, users often report issues like lockouts not being removed due to several causes. Such scenarios raise the demand for Realme GT 5 Nord FRP bypass solutions for seamless device access.

Part 1. What Is Google FRP and How Does It Work?

Google Factory Reset Protection (FRP) is an in-built security function in Android 5.1 and later versions. The feature protects these devices against intentional data loss on unauthorized access. The utility does not allow a factory reset of your device in case it is lost or stolen. Your data is hence, safe from unwanted mishandling. The feature also protects the Realme GT 5 device’s data encryptions and screen locks. The functionality gets enabled when you register a Google account on your Android device. As is obvious, the feature gets disabled when the Google account is removed before beginning the Factory Data Reset process.

If your device is under untrusted access and the FRP lock is enabled, the latter will prevent the factory reset of your phone. It is because; the active FRP lock requires entering the Google account credentials registered with the Realme GT 5 device. Therefore, unwanted users will not be possible to factory reset the Realme GT 5 phone. However, there may be instances when you need to factory reset your FRP-enabled device to its default settings. Ensure that the registered Google account credentials are available to you under such circumstances.

Part 2. How to Remove Google FRP Lock on Any Realme GT 5 Phone?

To remove the Google FRP lock on your Realme GT 5 device, you can follow any of the methods discussed below:

1. Bypass Google FRP Lock on Your Realme GT 5 Phone

  • Switch on the Wi-Fi network of the Realme GT 5 phone and head to the ‘Hello’ screen.
  • Take the following path:

Emergency Call> Emergency Rescue> Add Contact

  • When the permission prompt pops up, click on ‘Deny’ and tap “Go to Settings”.
  • Hit the ‘Permission’ tab and tap the ‘Search’ button.
  • Enter ‘Settings’ in the search field, choose the ‘Settings App Info’ option, and tap the ‘Open’ button.
  • Take the path given below to enable the system shortcuts:

System> Accessibility> Accessibility Menu> Toggle the Button to Turn it On> Allow> Got it

  • Head to the “Settings” app and tap “Apps and Notifications”. Next, click on “See All Apps”.
  • Find and disable the ‘Android Setup’ and ‘Google Play Service’ within the application list.

  • Navigate back to the ‘Hello’ screen to completely disable the setup by taking the following path:

Start> Agree> Agree> Skip> Don’t Copy> Ok> Agree

  • Skip the ‘Set Screen Lock’ task for completing the setup.

2. Using FRP Bypass APK

This is a quick and smart way to address the FRP lock removal issue within several minutes. Here’s what you need to do:

  • Download the FRP Bypass APK to a PC or some other smartphone from the latter’s official website, followed by copying it into a pen drive.
  • Use an OTG to connect the pen drive to the FRP-locked device.
  • Head to the destination folder of the downloaded APK in the “File Manager” application.
  • Install the APK in the FRP-locked phone by allowing the app permissions.
  • Navigate to ‘Settings’ and enable the ‘Install from Unknown Source’ option.
  • Reinstall and open the APK.
  • The ‘Settings’ menu will pop up. Head to the “Backup and Reset” option.
  • Click on ‘Factory Data Reset’, followed by “Erase Everything”.
  • Tap ‘Confirm’ to erase all the Realme GT 5 device data.
  • Register with a new Google account to use the phone.

3. Deactivate FRP in Your Realme GT 5 Phone

Removing the Google FRP lock using a computer is impossible in some instances. Deleting your registered Gmail account from the Realme GT 5 device can help you in these circumstances. The downside of this method is that your device’s data will lose protection from Google. Here’s how you can delete your Gmail account from the FRP-locked phone:

  • Launch the “Settings” app on your Realme GT 5 device.

  • In the app’s opening interface, click on the ‘Accounts’ tab to open the section.

  • A list of all the accounts linked to your Realme GT 5 device will be displayed. Tap on the desired Gmail account to unlink it from your phone.

  • The device data linked with the selected account will appear on the screen. Click on ‘Remove Account’ to proceed further.

  • A confirmation prompt will pop up to ensure a willful deletion of the account from the Realme GT 5 device. Tap on ‘Remove Account’ to confirm the action. This will cause all data linked with the account to get deleted from the phone.

FAQs about Google Lock Bypass

1. Does Factory Reset Remove Google Account?

There may be instances when you require wiping out smartphone data to keep it safe against unauthorized access. Maybe you wish to pass on your device to another user or migrate to a different device. It is important to make sure that all accounts linked to the phone are deleted from the Realme GT 5 device. It should be understood here that a factory reset will not remove Google or other accounts from the Realme GT 5 device. The process restores the default factory settings of the phone that you got at the first purchase.

2. How to Enable Factory Reset Protection?

Enabling the Factory Reset protection feature is a smart way to protect the important data on your phone. However, issues of unethical access in cases of theft or loss are quite prominent. You can enable the FRP functionality by taking the following steps:

  • When using a new device, sign in to the phone with your Google account. You can use an existing account or create a new one.
  • Set a pattern or password screen lock on your device. It is not advisable to use swipe unlock or leave the phone unlocked at all. If you forget the pattern or password, Google credentials can be used to unlock the Realme GT 5 device.

These steps will cause the automatic configuration of the Factory Reset Protection feature. The invader will be prompted to enter the registered Google account credentials on every attempt to access the phone.

Conclusion

Developments in electronic technology have brought a series of benefits, covering easy access, security, and everything in between. One such feature is the Google Factory Reset Protection to protect your device data against untrusted access. The feature is undoubtedly credible, but there may be situations that require bypassing the FRP lock. For affordable solutions to address the concern on Realme GT 5 phones, pick the one that corresponds to your specific situation.

Part 1: What is FRP lock on Realme?

Almost all smartphones come with multiple built-in security and protection features to ensure no 3rd party operator or tool can access the data stored in the system memory or the Realme GT 5 device. However, if someone initiates the factory reset in your Realme smartphone, the person will easily access everything in the Realme GT 5 device and the system.

This is where the FRP or factory reset protection program comes in. It is a built-in safety feature in smartphones that lock the Realme GT 5 device as soon as a factory reset is initiated or the user does not enter valid credentials for the Google account. Once the lock is activated, deactivation is very difficult, and it requires the credentials to access the system once again.

As a result, the user cannot restore the Realme GT 5 device to its default mode through a factory reset and wipe every data from both system and device memory. The FRP program has proven beneficial for optimal data protection from piracy and unauthorized access. This way, even if you lose your phone or it gets stolen, no one will be able to initiate the reset program to wipe everything from the Realme GT 5 device.

The FRP program is not available on all smartphones from Realme. Suppose you want to check whether it is compatible with your smartphone model, open settings from your phone, and go to the Realme GT 5 device information section. There, you will be able to see the factory reset option.

entry.title: How to Bypass Google FRP Lock from Realme GT Neo 5 Devices
entry.content:
How to Bypass Google FRP Lock on Realme GT Neo 5 Devices

Technological advancements in the IT and telecommunication industry simplify your tasks and provide security against cyber malpractices. The advantages are numerous and appealing, but there are downsides too. One such inconvenience is caused by Google FRP lock in Realme GT Neo 5 smartphones. The facility keeps your device information safe against unauthorized access. However, users often report issues like lockouts not being removed due to several causes. Such scenarios raise the demand for Realme GT Neo 5 Nord FRP bypass solutions for seamless device access.

Part 1. What Is Google FRP and How Does It Work?

Google Factory Reset Protection (FRP) is an in-built security function in Android 5.1 and later versions. The feature protects these devices against intentional data loss on unauthorized access. The utility does not allow a factory reset of your device in case it is lost or stolen. Your data is hence, safe from unwanted mishandling. The feature also protects the Realme GT Neo 5 device’s data encryptions and screen locks. The functionality gets enabled when you register a Google account on your Android device. As is obvious, the feature gets disabled when the Google account is removed before beginning the Factory Data Reset process.

If your device is under untrusted access and the FRP lock is enabled, the latter will prevent the factory reset of your phone. It is because; the active FRP lock requires entering the Google account credentials registered with the Realme GT Neo 5 device. Therefore, unwanted users will not be possible to factory reset the Realme GT Neo 5 phone. However, there may be instances when you need to factory reset your FRP-enabled device to its default settings. Ensure that the registered Google account credentials are available to you under such circumstances.

Part 2. How to Remove Google FRP Lock on Any Realme GT Neo 5 Phone?

To remove the Google FRP lock on your Realme GT Neo 5 device, you can follow any of the methods discussed below:

1. Bypass Google FRP Lock on Your Realme GT Neo 5 Phone

  • Switch on the Wi-Fi network of the Realme GT Neo 5 phone and head to the ‘Hello’ screen.
  • Take the following path:

Emergency Call> Emergency Rescue> Add Contact

  • When the permission prompt pops up, click on ‘Deny’ and tap “Go to Settings”.
  • Hit the ‘Permission’ tab and tap the ‘Search’ button.
  • Enter ‘Settings’ in the search field, choose the ‘Settings App Info’ option, and tap the ‘Open’ button.
  • Take the path given below to enable the system shortcuts:

System> Accessibility> Accessibility Menu> Toggle the Button to Turn it On> Allow> Got it

  • Head to the “Settings” app and tap “Apps and Notifications”. Next, click on “See All Apps”.
  • Find and disable the ‘Android Setup’ and ‘Google Play Service’ within the application list.

  • Navigate back to the ‘Hello’ screen to completely disable the setup by taking the following path:

Start> Agree> Agree> Skip> Don’t Copy> Ok> Agree

  • Skip the ‘Set Screen Lock’ task for completing the setup.

2. Using FRP Bypass APK

This is a quick and smart way to address the FRP lock removal issue within several minutes. Here’s what you need to do:

  • Download the FRP Bypass APK to a PC or some other smartphone from the latter’s official website, followed by copying it into a pen drive.
  • Use an OTG to connect the pen drive to the FRP-locked device.
  • Head to the destination folder of the downloaded APK in the “File Manager” application.
  • Install the APK in the FRP-locked phone by allowing the app permissions.
  • Navigate to ‘Settings’ and enable the ‘Install from Unknown Source’ option.
  • Reinstall and open the APK.
  • The ‘Settings’ menu will pop up. Head to the “Backup and Reset” option.
  • Click on ‘Factory Data Reset’, followed by “Erase Everything”.
  • Tap ‘Confirm’ to erase all the Realme GT Neo 5 device data.
  • Register with a new Google account to use the phone.

3. Deactivate FRP in Your Realme GT Neo 5 Phone

Removing the Google FRP lock using a computer is impossible in some instances. Deleting your registered Gmail account from the Realme GT Neo 5 device can help you in these circumstances. The downside of this method is that your device’s data will lose protection from Google. Here’s how you can delete your Gmail account from the FRP-locked phone:

  • Launch the “Settings” app on your Realme GT Neo 5 device.

  • In the app’s opening interface, click on the ‘Accounts’ tab to open the section.

  • A list of all the accounts linked to your Realme GT Neo 5 device will be displayed. Tap on the desired Gmail account to unlink it from your phone.

  • The device data linked with the selected account will appear on the screen. Click on ‘Remove Account’ to proceed further.

  • A confirmation prompt will pop up to ensure a willful deletion of the account from the Realme GT Neo 5 device. Tap on ‘Remove Account’ to confirm the action. This will cause all data linked with the account to get deleted from the phone.

FAQs about Google Lock Bypass

1. Does Factory Reset Remove Google Account?

There may be instances when you require wiping out smartphone data to keep it safe against unauthorized access. Maybe you wish to pass on your device to another user or migrate to a different device. It is important to make sure that all accounts linked to the phone are deleted from the Realme GT Neo 5 device. It should be understood here that a factory reset will not remove Google or other accounts from the Realme GT Neo 5 device. The process restores the default factory settings of the phone that you got at the first purchase.

Click here
### 2\. How to Enable Factory Reset Protection?

Enabling the Factory Reset protection feature is a smart way to protect the important data on your phone. However, issues of unethical access in cases of theft or loss are quite prominent. You can enable the FRP functionality by taking the following steps:

  • When using a new device, sign in to the phone with your Google account. You can use an existing account or create a new one.
  • Set a pattern or password screen lock on your device. It is not advisable to use swipe unlock or leave the phone unlocked at all. If you forget the pattern or password, Google credentials can be used to unlock the Realme GT Neo 5 device.

These steps will cause the automatic configuration of the Factory Reset Protection feature. The invader will be prompted to enter the registered Google account credentials on every attempt to access the phone.

Developments in electronic technology have brought a series of benefits, covering easy access, security, and everything in between. One such feature is the Google Factory Reset Protection to protect your device data against untrusted access. The feature is undoubtedly credible, but there may be situations that require bypassing the FRP lock. The feature also protects the Realme GT Neo 5 SE device’s data encryptions and screen locks. The functionality gets enabled when you register a Google account on your Android device. entry.title: How to Bypass Google FRP Lock from Realme Narzo N53 Devices

How to Bypass Google FRP Lock on Realme Narzo N53 Devices

Technological advancements in the IT and telecommunication industry simplify your tasks and provide security against cyber malpractices. The advantages are numerous and appealing, but there are downsides too. One such inconvenience is caused by Google FRP lock in Realme Narzo N53 smartphones. The facility keeps your device information safe against unauthorized access. However, users often report issues like lockouts not being removed due to several causes. Such scenarios raise the demand for Realme Narzo N53 Nord FRP bypass solutions for seamless device access.

Part 1. What Is Google FRP and How Does It Work?

Google Factory Reset Protection (FRP) is an in-built security function in Android 5.1 and later versions. The feature protects these devices against intentional data loss on unauthorized access. The utility does not allow a factory reset of your device in case it is lost or stolen. Your data is hence, safe from unwanted mishandling. The feature also protects the Realme Narzo N53 device’s data encryptions and screen locks. The functionality gets enabled when you register a Google account on your Android device. As is obvious, the feature gets disabled when the Google account is removed before beginning the Factory Data Reset process.

If your device is under untrusted access and the FRP lock is enabled, the latter will prevent the factory reset of your phone. It is because; the active FRP lock requires entering the Google account credentials registered with the Realme Narzo N53 device. Therefore, unwanted users will not be possible to factory reset the Realme Narzo N53 phone. However, there may be instances when you need to factory reset your FRP-enabled device to its default settings. Ensure that the registered Google account credentials are available to you under such circumstances.

Part 2. How to Remove Google FRP Lock on Any Realme Narzo N53 Phone?

To remove the Google FRP lock on your Realme Narzo N53 device, you can follow any of the methods discussed below:

1. Bypass Google FRP Lock on Your Realme Narzo N53 Phone

  • Switch on the Wi-Fi network of the Realme Narzo N53 phone and head to the ‘Hello’ screen.
  • Take the following path:

Emergency Call> Emergency Rescue> Add Contact

  • When the permission prompt pops up, click on ‘Deny’ and tap “Go to Settings”.
  • Hit the ‘Permission’ tab and tap the ‘Search’ button.
  • Enter ‘Settings’ in the search field, choose the ‘Settings App Info’ option, and tap the ‘Open’ button.
  • Take the path given below to enable the system shortcuts:

System> Accessibility> Accessibility Menu> Toggle the Button to Turn it On> Allow> Got it

  • Head to the “Settings” app and tap “Apps and Notifications”. Next, click on “See All Apps”.
  • Find and disable the ‘Android Setup’ and ‘Google Play Service’ within the application list.

  • Navigate back to the ‘Hello’ screen to completely disable the setup by taking the following path:

Start> Agree> Agree> Skip> Don’t Copy> Ok> Agree

  • Skip the ‘Set Screen Lock’ task for completing the setup.

2. Using FRP Bypass APK

This is a quick and smart way to address the FRP lock removal issue within several minutes. Here’s what you need to do:

  • Download the FRP Bypass APK to a PC or some other smartphone from the latter’s official website, followed by copying it into a pen drive.
  • Use an OTG to connect the pen drive to the FRP-locked device.
  • Head to the destination folder of the downloaded APK in the “File Manager” application.
  • Install the APK in the FRP-locked phone by allowing the app permissions.
  • Navigate to ‘Settings’ and enable the ‘Install from Unknown Source’ option.
  • Reinstall and open the APK.
  • The ‘Settings’ menu will pop up. Head to the “Backup and Reset” option.
  • Click on ‘Factory Data Reset’, followed by “Erase Everything”.
  • Tap ‘Confirm’ to erase all the Realme Narzo N53 device data.
  • Register with a new Google account to use the phone.

3. Deactivate FRP in Your Realme Narzo N53 Phone

Removing the Google FRP lock using a computer is impossible in some instances. Deleting your registered Gmail account from the Realme Narzo N53 device can help you in these circumstances. The downside of this method is that your device’s data will lose protection from Google. Here’s how you can delete your Gmail account from the FRP-locked phone:

  • Launch the “Settings” app on your Realme Narzo N53 device.

  • In the app’s opening interface, click on the ‘Accounts’ tab to open the section.

  • A list of all the accounts linked to your Realme Narzo N53 device will be displayed. Tap on the desired Gmail account to unlink it from your phone.

  • The device data linked with the selected account will appear on the screen. Click on ‘Remove Account’ to proceed further.

  • A confirmation prompt will pop up to ensure a willful deletion of the account from the Realme Narzo N53 device. Tap on ‘Remove Account’ to confirm the action. This will cause all data linked with the account to get deleted from the phone.

FAQs about Google Lock Bypass

Click here
### 1\. Does Factory Reset Remove Google Account?

There may be instances when you require wiping out smartphone data to keep it safe against unauthorized access. Maybe you wish to pass on your device to another user or migrate to a different device. It is important to make sure that all accounts linked to the phone are deleted from the Realme Narzo N53 device. It should be understood here that a factory reset will not remove Google or other accounts from the Realme Narzo N53 device. The process restores the default factory settings of the phone that you got at the first purchase.

2. How to Enable Factory Reset Protection?

Enabling the Factory Reset protection feature is a smart way to protect the important data on your phone. However, issues of unethical access in cases of theft or loss are quite prominent. You can enable the FRP functionality by taking the following steps:

  • When using a new device, sign in to the phone with your Google account. You can use an existing account or create a new one.
  • Set a pattern or password screen lock on your device. It is not advisable to use swipe unlock or leave the phone unlocked at all. If you forget the pattern or password, Google credentials can be used to unlock the Realme Narzo N53 device.

These steps will cause the automatic configuration of the Factory Reset Protection feature. The invader will be prompted to enter the registered Google account credentials on every attempt to access the phone.

One such feature is the Google Factory Reset Protection to protect your device data against untrusted access. The feature is undoubtedly credible, but there may be situations that require bypassing the FRP lock. How to Bypass Google FRP Lock on Realme Note 50 Devices

Part 1. What Is Google FRP and How Does It Work?

Google Factory Reset Protection (FRP) is an in-built security function in Android 5.1 and later versions. The feature protects these devices against intentional data loss on unauthorized access. The utility does not allow a factory reset of your device in case it is lost or stolen. Your data is hence, safe from unwanted mishandling. The feature also protects the Realme Note 50 device’s data encryptions and screen locks. The functionality gets enabled when you register a Google account on your Android device. As is obvious, the feature gets disabled when the Google account is removed before beginning the Factory Data Reset process.

If your device is under untrusted access and the FRP lock is enabled, the latter will prevent the factory reset of your phone. It is because; the active FRP lock requires entering the Google account credentials registered with the Realme Note 50 device. Therefore, unwanted users will not be possible to factory reset the Realme Note 50 phone. However, there may be instances when you need to factory reset your FRP-enabled device to its default settings. Ensure that the registered Google account credentials are available to you under such circumstances.

  • A confirmation prompt will pop up to ensure a willful deletion of the account from the Realme Note 50 device. Tap on ‘Remove Account’ to confirm the action. This will cause all data linked with the account to get deleted from the phone.

There may be instances when you require wiping out smartphone data to keep it safe against unauthorized access. Maybe you wish to pass on your device to another user or migrate to a different device. Enabling the Factory Reset protection feature is a smart way to protect the important data on your phone. However, issues of unethical access in cases of theft or loss are quite prominent. You can enable the FRP functionality by taking the following steps:

entry.title: How to Bypass Google FRP Lock from Realme V30T Devices
entry.content:
How to Bypass Google FRP Lock on Realme V30T Devices

Technological advancements in the IT and telecommunication industry simplify your tasks and provide security against cyber malpractices. The advantages are numerous and appealing, but there are downsides too. One such inconvenience is caused by Google FRP lock in Realme V30T smartphones. The facility keeps your device information safe against unauthorized access. However, users often report issues like lockouts not being removed due to several causes. Such scenarios raise the demand for Realme V30T Nord FRP bypass solutions for seamless device access.

Part 1. What Is Google FRP and How Does It Work?

Google Factory Reset Protection (FRP) is an in-built security function in Android 5.1 and later versions. The feature protects these devices against intentional data loss on unauthorized access. The utility does not allow a factory reset of your device in case it is lost or stolen. Your data is hence, safe from unwanted mishandling. The feature also protects the Realme V30T device’s data encryptions and screen locks. The functionality gets enabled when you register a Google account on your Android device. As is obvious, the feature gets disabled when the Google account is removed before beginning the Factory Data Reset process.

If your device is under untrusted access and the FRP lock is enabled, the latter will prevent the factory reset of your phone. It is because; the active FRP lock requires entering the Google account credentials registered with the Realme V30T device. Therefore, unwanted users will not be possible to factory reset the Realme V30T phone. However, there may be instances when you need to factory reset your FRP-enabled device to its default settings. Ensure that the registered Google account credentials are available to you under such circumstances.

Part 2. How to Remove Google FRP Lock on Any Realme V30T Phone?

To remove the Google FRP lock on your Realme V30T device, you can follow any of the methods discussed below:

1. Bypass Google FRP Lock on Your Realme V30T Phone

  • Switch on the Wi-Fi network of the Realme V30T phone and head to the ‘Hello’ screen.
  • Take the following path:

Emergency Call> Emergency Rescue> Add Contact

  • When the permission prompt pops up, click on ‘Deny’ and tap “Go to Settings”.
  • Hit the ‘Permission’ tab and tap the ‘Search’ button.
  • Enter ‘Settings’ in the search field, choose the ‘Settings App Info’ option, and tap the ‘Open’ button.
  • Take the path given below to enable the system shortcuts:

System> Accessibility> Accessibility Menu> Toggle the Button to Turn it On> Allow> Got it

  • Head to the “Settings” app and tap “Apps and Notifications”. Next, click on “See All Apps”.
  • Find and disable the ‘Android Setup’ and ‘Google Play Service’ within the application list.

  • Navigate back to the ‘Hello’ screen to completely disable the setup by taking the following path:

Start> Agree> Agree> Skip> Don’t Copy> Ok> Agree

  • Skip the ‘Set Screen Lock’ task for completing the setup.

2. Using FRP Bypass APK

This is a quick and smart way to address the FRP lock removal issue within several minutes. Here’s what you need to do:

  • Download the FRP Bypass APK to a PC or some other smartphone from the latter’s official website, followed by copying it into a pen drive.
  • Use an OTG to connect the pen drive to the FRP-locked device.
  • Head to the destination folder of the downloaded APK in the “File Manager” application.
  • Install the APK in the FRP-locked phone by allowing the app permissions.
  • Navigate to ‘Settings’ and enable the ‘Install from Unknown Source’ option.
  • Reinstall and open the APK.
  • The ‘Settings’ menu will pop up. Head to the “Backup and Reset” option.
  • Click on ‘Factory Data Reset’, followed by “Erase Everything”.
  • Tap ‘Confirm’ to erase all the Realme V30T device data.
  • Register with a new Google account to use the phone.

3. Deactivate FRP in Your Realme V30T Phone

Removing the Google FRP lock using a computer is impossible in some instances. Deleting your registered Gmail account from the Realme V30T device can help you in these circumstances. The downside of this method is that your device’s data will lose protection from Google. Here’s how you can delete your Gmail account from the FRP-locked phone:

  • Launch the “Settings” app on your Realme V30T device.

  • In the app’s opening interface, click on the ‘Accounts’ tab to open the section.

  • A list of all the accounts linked to your Realme V30T device will be displayed. Tap on the desired Gmail account to unlink it from your phone.

  • The device data linked with the selected account will appear on the screen. Click on ‘Remove Account’ to proceed further.

  • A confirmation prompt will pop up to ensure a willful deletion of the account from the Realme V30T device. Tap on ‘Remove Account’ to confirm the action. This will cause all data linked with the account to get deleted from the phone.

FAQs about Google Lock Bypass

1. Does Factory Reset Remove Google Account?

There may be instances when you require wiping out smartphone data to keep it safe against unauthorized access. Maybe you wish to pass on your device to another user or migrate to a different device. It is important to make sure that all accounts linked to the phone are deleted from the Realme V30T device. It should be understood here that a factory reset will not remove Google or other accounts from the Realme V30T device. The process restores the default factory settings of the phone that you got at the first purchase.

2. How to Enable Factory Reset Protection?

Enabling the Factory Reset protection feature is a smart way to protect the important data on your phone. However, issues of unethical access in cases of theft or loss are quite prominent. You can enable the FRP functionality by taking the following steps:

  • When using a new device, sign in to the phone with your Google account. You can use an existing account or create a new one.
  • Set a pattern or password screen lock on your device. It is not advisable to use swipe unlock or leave the phone unlocked at all. If you forget the pattern or password, Google credentials can be used to unlock the Realme V30T device.

These steps will cause the automatic configuration of the Factory Reset Protection feature. The invader will be prompted to enter the registered Google account credentials on every attempt to access the phone.

Conclusion

Developments in electronic technology have brought a series of benefits, covering easy access, security, and everything in between. One such feature is the Google Factory Reset Protection to protect your device data against untrusted access. The feature is undoubtedly credible, but there may be situations that require bypassing the FRP lock. For affordable solutions to address the concern on Realme V30T phones, pick the one that corresponds to your specific situation.

How to Bypass Google FRP Lock on Honor 100 Devices

Technological advancements in the IT and telecommunication industry simplify your tasks and provide security against cyber malpractices. The advantages are numerous and appealing, but there are downsides too. One such inconvenience is caused by Google FRP lock in Honor 100 smartphones. The facility keeps your device information safe against unauthorized access. However, users often report issues like lockouts not being removed due to several causes. Such scenarios raise the demand for Honor 100 Nord FRP bypass solutions for seamless device access.

Part 1. What Is Google FRP and How Does It Work?

Google Factory Reset Protection (FRP) is an in-built security function in Android 5.1 and later versions. The feature protects these devices against intentional data loss on unauthorized access. The utility does not allow a factory reset of your device in case it is lost or stolen. Your data is hence, safe from unwanted mishandling. The feature also protects the Honor 100 device’s data encryptions and screen locks. The functionality gets enabled when you register a Google account on your Android device. As is obvious, the feature gets disabled when the Google account is removed before beginning the Factory Data Reset process.

If your device is under untrusted access and the FRP lock is enabled, the latter will prevent the factory reset of your phone. It is because; the active FRP lock requires entering the Google account credentials registered with the Honor 100 device. Therefore, unwanted users will not be possible to factory reset the Honor 100 phone. However, there may be instances when you need to factory reset your FRP-enabled device to its default settings. Ensure that the registered Google account credentials are available to you under such circumstances.

Part 2. How to Remove Google FRP Lock on Any Honor 100 Phone?

To remove the Google FRP lock on your Honor 100 device, you can follow any of the methods discussed below:

1. Bypass Google FRP Lock on Your Honor 100 Phone

  • Switch on the Wi-Fi network of the Honor 100 phone and head to the ‘Hello’ screen.
  • Take the following path:

Emergency Call> Emergency Rescue> Add Contact

  • When the permission prompt pops up, click on ‘Deny’ and tap “Go to Settings”.
  • Hit the ‘Permission’ tab and tap the ‘Search’ button.
  • Enter ‘Settings’ in the search field, choose the ‘Settings App Info’ option, and tap the ‘Open’ button.
  • Take the path given below to enable the system shortcuts:

System> Accessibility> Accessibility Menu> Toggle the Button to Turn it On> Allow> Got it

  • Head to the “Settings” app and tap “Apps and Notifications”. Next, click on “See All Apps”.
  • Find and disable the ‘Android Setup’ and ‘Google Play Service’ within the application list.

  • Navigate back to the ‘Hello’ screen to completely disable the setup by taking the following path:

Start> Agree> Agree> Skip> Don’t Copy> Ok> Agree

  • Skip the ‘Set Screen Lock’ task for completing the setup.

2. Using FRP Bypass APK

  • Use an OTG to connect the pen drive to the FRP-locked device.
  • Head to the destination folder of the downloaded APK in the “File Manager” application.
  • Install the APK in the FRP-locked phone by allowing the app permissions.
  • Navigate to ‘Settings’ and enable the ‘Install from Unknown Source’ option.
  • Reinstall and open the APK.
  • The ‘Settings’ menu will pop up. Head to the “Backup and Reset” option.
  • Click on ‘Factory Data Reset’, followed by “Erase Everything”.
  • Tap ‘Confirm’ to erase all the Honor 100 device data.
  • Register with a new Google account to use the phone.

3. Deactivate FRP in Your Honor 100 Phone

Removing the Google FRP lock using a computer is impossible in some instances. Deleting your registered Gmail account from the Honor 100 device can help you in these circumstances. The downside of this method is that your device’s data will lose protection from Google. Here’s how you can delete your Gmail account from the FRP-locked phone:

  • Launch the “Settings” app on your Honor 100 device.

  • In the app’s opening interface, click on the ‘Accounts’ tab to open the section.

  • A list of all the accounts linked to your Honor 100 device will be displayed. Tap on the desired Gmail account to unlink it from your phone.

  • The device data linked with the selected account will appear on the screen. Click on ‘Remove Account’ to proceed further.

  • A confirmation prompt will pop up to ensure a willful deletion of the account from the Honor 100 device. Tap on ‘Remove Account’ to confirm the action. This will cause all data linked with the account to get deleted from the phone.

FAQs about Google Lock Bypass

1. Does Factory Reset Remove Google Account?

There may be instances when you require wiping out smartphone data to keep it safe against unauthorized access. Maybe you wish to pass on your device to another user or migrate to a different device. It is important to make sure that all accounts linked to the phone are deleted from the Honor 100 device. It should be understood here that a factory reset will not remove Google or other accounts from the Honor 100 device. The process restores the default factory settings of the phone that you got at the first purchase.

2. How to Enable Factory Reset Protection?

Enabling the Factory Reset protection feature is a smart way to protect the important data on your phone. However, issues of unethical access in cases of theft or loss are quite prominent. You can enable the FRP functionality by taking the following steps:

  • When using a new device, sign in to the phone with your Google account. You can use an existing account or create a new one.
  • Set a pattern or password screen lock on your device. It is not advisable to use swipe unlock or leave the phone unlocked at all. If you forget the pattern or password, Google credentials can be used to unlock the Honor 100 device.

These steps will cause the automatic configuration of the Factory Reset Protection feature. The invader will be prompted to enter the registered Google account credentials on every attempt to access the phone.

Developments in electronic technology have brought a series of benefits, covering easy access, security, and everything in between. One such feature is the Google Factory Reset Protection to protect your device data against untrusted access. The feature is undoubtedly credible, but there may be situations that require bypassing the FRP lock. How to Bypass Google FRP Lock on Honor 90 GT Devices

Technological advancements in the IT and telecommunication industry simplify your tasks and provide security against cyber malpractices. The advantages are numerous and appealing, but there are downsides too. One such inconvenience is caused by Google FRP lock in Honor 90 GT smartphones. The facility keeps your device information safe against unauthorized access. However, users often report issues like lockouts not being removed due to several causes. Such scenarios raise the demand for Honor 90 GT Nord FRP bypass solutions for seamless device access.

Part 1. What Is Google FRP and How Does It Work?

Google Factory Reset Protection (FRP) is an in-built security function in Android 5.1 and later versions. The feature protects these devices against intentional data loss on unauthorized access. The utility does not allow a factory reset of your device in case it is lost or stolen. Your data is hence, safe from unwanted mishandling. The feature also protects the Honor 90 GT device’s data encryptions and screen locks. The functionality gets enabled when you register a Google account on your Android device. As is obvious, the feature gets disabled when the Google account is removed before beginning the Factory Data Reset process.

If your device is under untrusted access and the FRP lock is enabled, the latter will prevent the factory reset of your phone. It is because; the active FRP lock requires entering the Google account credentials registered with the Honor 90 GT device. Therefore, unwanted users will not be possible to factory reset the Honor 90 GT phone. However, there may be instances when you need to factory reset your FRP-enabled device to its default settings. Ensure that the registered Google account credentials are available to you under such circumstances.

Part 2. How to Remove Google FRP Lock on Any Honor 90 GT Phone?

To remove the Google FRP lock on your Honor 90 GT device, you can follow any of the methods discussed below:

1. Bypass Google FRP Lock on Your Honor 90 GT Phone

  • Switch on the Wi-Fi network of the Honor 90 GT phone and head to the ‘Hello’ screen.
  • Take the following path:

Emergency Call> Emergency Rescue> Add Contact

  • When the permission prompt pops up, click on ‘Deny’ and tap “Go to Settings”.
  • Hit the ‘Permission’ tab and tap the ‘Search’ button.
  • Enter ‘Settings’ in the search field, choose the ‘Settings App Info’ option, and tap the ‘Open’ button.
  • Take the path given below to enable the system shortcuts:

System> Accessibility> Accessibility Menu> Toggle the Button to Turn it On> Allow> Got it

  • Head to the “Settings” app and tap “Apps and Notifications”. Next, click on “See All Apps”.
  • Find and disable the ‘Android Setup’ and ‘Google Play Service’ within the application list.

  • Navigate back to the ‘Hello’ screen to completely disable the setup by taking the following path:

Start> Agree> Agree> Skip> Don’t Copy> Ok> Agree

  • Skip the ‘Set Screen Lock’ task for completing the setup.

2. Using FRP Bypass APK

This is a quick and smart way to address the FRP lock removal issue within several minutes. Here’s what you need to do:

  • Use an OTG to connect the pen drive to the FRP-locked device.
  • Head to the destination folder of the downloaded APK in the “File Manager” application.
  • Install the APK in the FRP-locked phone by allowing the app permissions.
  • Navigate to ‘Settings’ and enable the ‘Install from Unknown Source’ option.
  • Reinstall and open the APK.
  • The ‘Settings’ menu will pop up. Head to the “Backup and Reset” option.
  • Click on ‘Factory Data Reset’, followed by “Erase Everything”.
  • Tap ‘Confirm’ to erase all the Honor 90 GT device data.
  • Register with a new Google account to use the phone.

3. Deactivate FRP in Your Honor 90 GT Phone

Removing the Google FRP lock using a computer is impossible in some instances. Deleting your registered Gmail account from the Honor 90 GT device can help you in these circumstances. The downside of this method is that your device’s data will lose protection from Google. Here’s how you can delete your Gmail account from the FRP-locked phone:

  • Launch the “Settings” app on your Honor 90 GT device.

  • In the app’s opening interface, click on the ‘Accounts’ tab to open the section.

  • A list of all the accounts linked to your Honor 90 GT device will be displayed. Tap on the desired Gmail account to unlink it from your phone.

  • The device data linked with the selected account will appear on the screen. Click on ‘Remove Account’ to proceed further.

  • A confirmation prompt will pop up to ensure a willful deletion of the account from the Honor 90 GT device. Tap on ‘Remove Account’ to confirm the action. This will cause all data linked with the account to get deleted from the phone.

FAQs about Google Lock Bypass

1. Does Factory Reset Remove Google Account?

There may be instances when you require wiping out smartphone data to keep it safe against unauthorized access. Maybe you wish to pass on your device to another user or migrate to a different device. It is important to make sure that all accounts linked to the phone are deleted from the Honor 90 GT device. It should be understood here that a factory reset will not remove Google or other accounts from the Honor 90 GT device. The process restores the default factory settings of the phone that you got at the first purchase.

2. How to Enable Factory Reset Protection?

Enabling the Factory Reset protection feature is a smart way to protect the important data on your phone. However, issues of unethical access in cases of theft or loss are quite prominent. You can enable the FRP functionality by taking the following steps:

  • When using a new device, sign in to the phone with your Google account. You can use an existing account or create a new one.
  • Set a pattern or password screen lock on your device. It is not advisable to use swipe unlock or leave the phone unlocked at all. If you forget the pattern or password, Google credentials can be used to unlock the Honor 90 GT device.

These steps will cause the automatic configuration of the Factory Reset Protection feature. The invader will be prompted to enter the registered Google account credentials on every attempt to access the phone.

Conclusion

Developments in electronic technology have brought a series of benefits, covering easy access, security, and everything in between. One such feature is the Google Factory Reset Protection to protect your device data against untrusted access. The feature is undoubtedly credible, but there may be situations that require bypassing the FRP lock. For affordable solutions to address the concern on Honor 90 GT phones, pick the one that corresponds to your specific situation.

A Step-by-Step Guide on Using ADB and Fastboot to Remove FRP Lock on your Honor 90 GT

Factory Reset Protection is one of the security measures available on Android 5.1 and later devices to prevent intruders’ unauthorized factory resetting of the Honor 90 GT device. Among the several ways to fix this issue and remove the lock, one is ADB and Fastboot commands. So, if you are aware of using Android Debug Bridge, the below content will help you understand how it can be used to remove the FRP lock.

You can watch the video below to bypass FRP lock without hassle!

Part 1: Quick Overview of ADB and Fastboot Commands

1. What are ADB and Fastboot?

Standing for Android Debug Bridge, ADB and Fastboots are the methods through which communication with an Android device can be done through a computer. Under this method, the commands and the actions that are sent from the system are performed on your Android device.

Several issues can be resolved, and multiple functions can be performed using the ADB format tool and Fastboots, and this also includes removing the FRP lock on your Android device. To use this method, USB debugging should be enabled on the Honor 90 GT device.

For specific brands of Android phones, specific utility tools are available like the Vivo ADB format tool and the Samsung ADB format tool, which are used explicitly for Vivo and Samsung phones, respectively.

2. How Do ADB and Fastboot Bypass FRP?

Using the versatile ADB command-line tool and Fastboots, the Google FRP lock can be removed using several commands depending on the OS version. This is a client-server program that includes a client who sends the commands, a daemon used to run the commands on the Honor 90 GT device, and a server that facilitates communication between the client and the daemon.

ADB comes included in the Android SDK Platform-Tools package, and this can be downloaded using the SDK manager.

3. What Are the Android Versions that ADB and Fastboot Command Support?

The Android versions on which ADB and Fastboot commands can be used are as follows:

  • _Android 5 – Lollipop_
  • _Android 6- Marshmellow_
  • _Android 7 – Nougat_
  • _Android 8- Oreo_
  • _Android 9- Pie_
  • _Android 10 – Q (expected to work though not tested as yet)_

Part 2: How to Set Up ADB and Fastboot Commands to Remove FRP Lock on Android?

To remove FRP lock using ADB, you first need to install and set up ADB and then remove them using the command. The steps for the same are enlisted below.

Steps to remove FRP using ADB

  • Step 1. Firstly, download the ADB installed setup file and then extract the files from the toolkit on your system in a folder.

  • Step 2. Next, you need to run adb.setup.exe and then type Y for installing the drivers for ADB and Fastboot.

  • Step 3. Again, enter Y for installing the drivers and when done successfully, the command window will close.

  • Step 4. Next, power on your Android device and connect it to your PC using a USB cable. Here also ensure that USB debugging mode is enabled on your Android device.

  • Step 5. Next, hold down the Shift key and then right-click at any place blank in the ADB folder, and then choose the Open command window here option.

  • Step 6. Now to remove the FRP you need to enter the following commands at the command prompt one by one where enter needs to be clicked after every line.

  • _Adb shell am start -n com.google.android.gsf.login/_

  • _adb shell am start -n com.google.android.gsf.login.LoginActivity_

  • _adb shell content insert –uri content://settings/secure –bind name:s:user_setup_complete –bind value:s:1_

  • Step 7. The above commands are for Samsung devices. If you want to remove the FRP on other brands, enter the following commands:

  • _Adb shell content insert –uri content://settings/secure –bind_

  • _name:s:user_setup_complete –bind value:s:1_

After the execution of the commands, the FRP lock will be removed from your Android device.

Steps to remove FRP using Fastboot

  • Step 1. Put the Android device into the bootloader or fastboot mode. (depending on the model and brand of your Android device, the process of entering into the fastboot will differ).

  • Step 2. Connect your phone to your PC using a USB cable.

  • Step 3. Next, depending on the system, enter the following command in the CMD window:

  • _Lenovo FRP command_

  • _fastboot erase config_

  • _fastboot reboot_

  • _XIAOMI FRP command_

  • _fastboot -w_

  • _MICROMAX YU YUPHORIA FRP_
